channel.title: Kane County|Utah|United States on Roadsign Pictures
channel.description: Recent content in Kane County|Utah|United States on Roadsign Pictures

item.title: US-89 South at UT-9
item.description: US-89 south at UT-9 at Mt Carmel Junction. UT-9 is a Utah Scenic Byway.

item.title: US-89 South Approaching UT-9
item.description: US-89 south approaching UT-9. Continue south on UT-9 for Kanab, Lake Powell, and Grand Canyon.

item.title: US-89 South Approaching UT-9
item.description: US-89 south approaching UT-9 south. UT-9 south is a Utah Scenic Byway.

item.title: Entering Mt. Carmel Junction on US-89 South
item.description: Entering Mt. Carmel Junction on US-89 south Mt. Carmel Junction is at the junction of UT-9 and US-89 on the east side of Zion National Park.

item.title: US-89 South at UT-14
item.description: US-89 South at UT-14 west at Long Valley Junction.

item.title: US-89 South at UT-14
item.description: UT-89 south at UT-14 west to Duck Creek, Cedar Breaks (National Monument), and Cedar City. Continue south on US-89 for Mt. Carmel Junction.

item.title: US-89 South Approaching UT-14
item.description: US-89 South approaching UT-14 at Long Valley Junction.

item.title: US-89 North at UT-14 West
item.description: US-89 north at UT-14 west. Both UT-14 and US-89 are Utah Scenic Byways.

item.title: US-89 North Approaching UT-14
item.description: US-89 North approaching UT-14 at Long Valley Junction. Use UT-14 west for Cedar City, Duck Creek, and Cedar Breaks National Monument. Continue north on US-89 for Panguitch and Salt Lake.

item.title: End UT-9 East at US-89
item.description: End UT-9 East at US-89 at Mt. Carmel Junction. US-89 is marked as a Utah Scenic Byway.

item.title: UT-9 East Approaching US-89
item.description: UT-9 East approaching US-89 at Mt. Carmel Junction. US-89 is signed as a Utah Scenic Byway.

item.title: UT-9 East - Mt. Carmel Junctino
item.description: Mt. Carmel Junction on UT-9 east.

item.title: US-89 North at US-89A
item.description: US-89 north at US-89A. Turn left for US-89A; right to continue north on US-89. Until recently US-89A in Utah was marked as UT-11.

item.title: US-89 North Approaching US-89A
item.description: US-89 North approaching US-89A in Kanab.

item.title: US-89 North Approaching US-89A
item.description: US-89 North approaching US-89A. Use US-89A south for Fredonia, Jacob Lake, and Grand Canyon (all destinations in Arizona). Continue north on US-89 north for Panguitch, Zion National Park, and Bryce Canyon National Park.

item.title: UT-308 North - Kodachrome Basin
item.description: UT-308 north on Kodachrome Basin Road. This was taken north of Cottonwood Wash Rd. junction. UT-308 does not connect to the state highway system.

item.title: End UT-14 East at US-89
item.description: End UT-14 east at US-89. US-89 is marked as a Utah scenic byway.

item.title: End UT-14 East at US-89
item.description: UT-14 east approaching US-89. Use US-89 north for Panguitch and Bryce Canyon. Use US-89 south for Kanab.

item.title: US-89 South at UT-11 to US-89A
item.description: US-89 at UT-11 junction in Kanab. UT-11 turns into US-89A at the Arizona Line.

item.title: US-89 South at UT-9 West
item.description: US-89 south at UT-9 west to Zion NP
